title: 3 Easy Ways to Add a PowerPoint to iMovie

steps.title: Open a PowerPoint presentation.
steps.content: Open a PowerPoint presentation. Do so by double-clicking the orange app that's shaped like or contains a P . Click File in the menu bar and Open… . Then select the PowerPoint presentation you want to add to iMovie.

steps.title: Click File in the menu bar.
steps.content: Click File in the menu bar.

steps.title: Click Export….
steps.content: Click Export… . In older versions of PowerPoint, click Save as Movie... and Save . Doing so saves the PowerPoint in QuickTime movie (MOV) format.

steps.title: Click the File Format drop-down.
steps.content: Click the File Format drop-down.

steps.title: Click MP4.
steps.content: Click MP4 . You can also save it in QuickTime movie (MOV) format, but MP4 produces a higher-quality result. The Quality drop-down should be set to "Presentation Quality" for the best-quality video.

steps.title: Click Export.
steps.content: Click Export . It may take a few minutes for PowerPoint to convert the presentation to a video.

steps.title: Open iMovie.
steps.content: Open iMovie. It's a purple star-shaped app with a white movie camera icon.

steps.title: Click the Media tab.
steps.content: Click the Media tab. It's at the top of the window.

steps.title: Click File in the menu bar at the top of the screen.
steps.content: Click File in the menu bar at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Click Import Media….
steps.content: Click Import Media… .

steps.title: Click the Import to: drop-down at the top of the window.
steps.content: Click the Import to: drop-down at the top of the window.

steps.title: Click a destination for the new video.
steps.content: Click a destination for the new video. You can save it directly to a project or add it to your iMovie Media Library to use later.

steps.title: Select the location of the video.
steps.content: Select the location of the video. Use the menu on the left side of the window to select the folder or location where you saved the converted PowerPoint presentation.

steps.title: Click the PowerPoint presentation video file.
steps.content: Click the PowerPoint presentation video file. It will be listed on the right side of the window after you've selected the folder or location where it is saved.

steps.title: Click Import Selected in the lower-right.
steps.content: Click Import Selected in the lower-right. The video file of the PowerPoint will be imported to the destination you selected in iMovie. To add the video to another project, double-click a project under the Projects tab, then click My Media in the upper-left, and drag the new video down to your project's timeline.

steps.title: Add the PowerPoint video file to your Photos app
steps.content: Add the PowerPoint video file to your Photos app on Mac.

steps.title: Transfer the video file to the Photos app on your iPhone or iPad
steps.content: Transfer the video file to the Photos app on your iPhone or iPad . Your PowerPoint video must be in MP4 format to transfer to iPhone or iPad.

steps.title: Open the iMovie app on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open the iMovie app on your iPhone or iPad. It's a purple app with a white star and a movie camera icon.

steps.title: Tap the Projects tab.
steps.content: Tap the Projects tab. It's at the top of the screen. If iMovie opened into a video or different tab, tap the "back" link in the upper-left corner of the screen until you see three tabs at the top of the screen: Video , Projects , and Theater .

steps.title: Tap ＋ Create Project.
steps.content: Tap ＋ Create Project. Alternatively, you can tap an existing project instead.

steps.title: Tap Movie.
steps.content: Tap Movie . It's near the top of the "New Project" window.

steps.title: Select your video and tap Create Movie.
steps.content: Select your video and tap Create Movie . It's at the bottom of the screen. This will download your video and add it to your iMovie timeline.

steps.title: Edit your video.
steps.content: Edit your video. You can edit your video in several different ways. Tap ＋ to add more media. Tap ◀ to go back to the beginning of the video. Tap ▶ to preview the video.

steps.title: Tap Done when you're done.
steps.content: Tap Done when you're done.
